configuration.dashboardSubtitle: Comprehensive Analysis of Research Output, Global Standing, and Institutional Ecosystem

summary.title: Research Impact Overview
insights: India contributed 27 research papers to ICML 2024, representing 1.0% of the conference's total accepted works and ranking 20th globally among contributing nations.

Indian researchers demonstrated strong research leadership with 63% of papers featuring Indian first authors, indicating significant intellectual contribution to the global machine learning discourse.
The research quality is evidenced by a 3.7% spotlight acceptance rate, with one paper receiving this prestigious recognition among the conference's most impactful contributions.
India's machine learning ecosystem comprises 45 unique researchers across 14 institutions, with a balanced representation of 12 academic institutions and 2 corporate research entities.

context.title: Global Research Landscape
context.subtitle: India's position within the international machine learning research community and comparative analysis with leading nations.
insights: The global research landscape is led by the United States (54.3% of papers) and China (29.6%), followed by the United Kingdom (8.2%) and Germany (6.7%), with India contributing 1.0% of total research output.
India ranks 20th globally in research volume, positioning it as an emerging contributor in the international machine learning research ecosystem with substantial growth potential.

Within the Asia-Pacific region, India trails China, South Korea, Singapore, and Hong Kong in absolute research contributions, highlighting opportunities for enhanced regional collaboration and capacity building.

focusCountry.title: Indian Research Ecosystem Analysis
focusCountry.subtitle: Detailed examination of authorship patterns, collaboration dynamics, and research leadership within India's machine learning community.
insights: Indian researchers exhibit strong research independence with 29.6% of papers having majority Indian authorship, indicating substantial domestic research capacity and reduced dependence on international collaboration.
The 63% first authorship rate demonstrates Indian researchers' leadership in conceptualizing and driving research projects, reflecting growing confidence and expertise in the field.
With 45 unique authors contributing across 27 papers, India maintains an efficient author-to-paper ratio of 1.7, suggesting productive individual contributions and effective research mentorship.

institutions.title: Institutional Research (early preview)
institutions.subtitle: Comprehensive evaluation of India's academic and corporate institutions contributing to machine learning research excellence.
insights: The Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore emerges as the national leader with 5 papers and 8 authors, including the country's only spotlight paper, demonstrating exceptional research quality and productivity.

Academic institutions dominate India's research landscape with 85.7% representation (12 of 14 institutions), while corporate research centers contribute 14.3%, indicating strong university-led research culture.

The institutional diversity spans premier engineering institutes (IITs), specialized research universities (IISc), and corporate R&D centers, creating a robust ecosystem for sustained machine learning research growth.
